description: After seeing credible evidence of BCI-free areas, Rada decides to focus her next report on these rare, liberated zones. She consults trusted contacts to verify the extent of unmonitored gatherings.

Rada breaks the story about 'Halden Zones'—districts where BCI oversight has failed and residents experience brief freedoms. The feature goes out on multiple channels, sparking immediate public interest.

Spurred by Rada’s reporting, people flock to the Halden Zones. Large crowds gather for open protests, art events, and discussions, enabled by gaps in BCI enforcement. Council officials call emergency sessions to discuss the spreading disruption.
Unpredictable power, transport, and BCI scoring continue in these areas, leading to temporary relief from restrictions and giving momentum to citizen solidarity actions.

A Council briefing confirms Halden Zones emerged in areas where Halden secretly installed experimental BCI feedback loops. Internal debate intensifies over whether to restore full control by force or use selective concessions to pacify the unrest.
